meanings.definition: a cord or string used to tighten or close the opening of a garment or bag
meanings.sent1: I pulled the drawstrings on my hoodie to make it snug around my neck.
meanings.sent2: She tied the drawstrings of her backpack securely before heading out.
meanings.sent3: The drawstrings on the pajama pants played a game of tug-of-war with me.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like drawstrings, pulling her closer with each sentence.
meanings.sent5: The drawstrings whispered promises of comfort as she cinched them tight.

meanings.definition: the act of pulling or tightening a drawstring to close something
meanings.sent1: With a quick tug, the drawstrings sealed the bag shut.
meanings.sent2: The drawstrings on the curtain allowed for easy opening and closing.
meanings.sent3: The drawstrings seemed to have a mind of their own, playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the drawstrings of a pouch, pulling everything together.
meanings.sent5: The drawstrings danced in her fingers, bringing a sense of closure to the moment.
